course.title: 2021 Complete Python Bootcamp From Zero to Hero in Python
course.subtitle: Learn Python like a Professional Start from the basics and go all the way to creating your own applications and games

reviews.body: I am a complete beginner and I must say I love the course Jose actually went from very basic right up to advance topics, One thing which i would like to ask Jose to improve is Final Capstone Project section, Instead of letting us choose from if there is one provided with the solution that would be great

Thank you for offering this course.. It should be really useful for the students.. And one more thing, please add some interview/placement related topic.. which is more impotent.. otherwise the course is good...
Huge amount of great material in this course. Reason for undertaking the course is I needed to develop some Python skills to tackle my Masters dissertation which I will be starting soon.
This course is fantastic! I learned so much so far, and I knew nothing about any programming languages. Thanks Jose!!
I enjoyed learning at my pace. I am glad that I could grow my skills as a new programmer!

Excelent course. Support material and lectures very well prepared. Explanations are clear and objective. It is really possible to learn a lot of Pyhton, specially if you start from zero. Looking forward to go deeply in Python by taking other courses from the author.
The explanation was crisp and clear and the slides used in the lectures were good. I believe its a pretty good course to start learning python.
Awesome course. I have only good things to say about this course. All topics are well explained. The notes are clear and exercises are very practical. Thank you.

Great course! Me being a software engineer on other technologies, this course provides the tools to get you started with Python. I would love if the course included an additional session to explore a Python IDE (e.g. PyCharm), but other than that the course is great and I highly recommend it as a starting point for Python.
The course is amazing and all the explanations are on point!

I started with C language. But I always felt that coding is not my cup of tea.

But this course entirely shattered my views on coding. This course is definitely what would I suggest to my peers or juniors to begin to code.

The course covers all the very basics of Python 3, plus some useful functionalities of it when Python is used with Jupyter. Also, the course touches some external libraries, after passing which, ideas of practical implementation of your Python skills may start occur in your mind.

However, I found these following cons of the course:

- It really touches ONLY language, i.e. not Computer Science itself. You most likely start to understand how the language works but without real fundamentals behind it.

- Especially OOP part, it does won't teach you how you should THINK in order to code in OOP paradigm. For me, that was critical. And because of this I dropped this course multiple times. Only after A LOT of googling, I started to comprehend this paradigm.

- Sometimes, I caught the feeling that I was just following what Jose doing. In some parts, this course won't teach you, but just gives you 'mechanical' exercises passing which you don't think too much.

- Taking into the account aforementioned, you MUST google a lot and READ documentations a lot in order to grab deep understanding of programming (not Python itself).

Despite so large 'cons' lists, I really recommend this course. It brings real value for its price. And with a good motivation it may push you to learn programming further.

Thanks, Jose, for the course. It was a real pleasure following it. You did a great job! :)

instructor.name: Jose Portilla
instructor.briefIntroduction: Jose Marcial Portilla has a BS and MS in Mechanical Engineering from Santa Clara University and years of experience as a professional instructor and trainer for Data Science and programming. He has publications and patents in various fields such as microfluidics, materials science, and data science technologies. Over the course of his career he has developed a skill set in analyzing data and he hopes to use his experience in teaching and data science to help other people learn the power of programming the ability to analyze data, as well as present the data in clear and beautiful visualizations. Currently he works as the Head of Data Science for Pierian Data Inc. and provides in-person data science and python programming training courses to employees working at top companies, including General Electric, Cigna, The New York Times, Credit Suisse, McKinsey and many more. Feel free to contact him on LinkedIn for more information on in-person training sessions or group training sessions in Las Vegas, NV.
